channel.title: Please be understanding
channel.description: As it turns out, I am completely unable to make a RSPS! I am so pissed off at this point.. I would love for someone to make me a server. Trust me, im not doing this out of laziness. If anyone could do this good deed please comment, thank you for your time.

item.title: Please be understanding
item.dc:creator: @Devilhotkid Devilhotkid
item.description:
@Devilhotkid wrote:

Im sorry, not Port forwarding, Enviromental Variables. I need help with that, I have Vista fyi

Read full topic

item.title: Please be understanding
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

One: Post the errors like I said, ask a questions like what does this error mean?

Two: I strongly suggest you read through all the sticky topics in this section and the Tutorial Section, before you ask any questions, they may answer them for you.

Three: Port forwarding is one of the easiest parts of setting up a server, first you must make sure your computer allows incoming and out going requests to the port your server is set to, the default ports are either 43594 or 5555. Next you will need to log into your router and go to the port forwarding section of the router. Open your network settings and get you IP address it should be something like 192.168.1.23 or something on the lines of that, not the default gateway. Next go back to the port forwarding tab and add your ip address and port number into the specified blocks. If you did this correctly port 43594 or 5555 should now allow in going and out going requests.

Read full topic
